summary: The Saving the Forest Service's Workforce Act (H.R. 4853) aims to protect Forest Service employees. It institutes a moratorium on reductions in force and involuntary separations for non-cause reasons until the full-year appropriations for fiscal year 2026 are enacted. The bill references definitions from U.S. Code Title 5 regarding employee classification (competitive, excepted, and Senior Executive Service) and clarifies that the moratorium supplements existing personnel action authorities.
